#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Eat Soup Politely
#Text=Eating soup politely is dependent on the company you keep to some extent but there are some key elements to make it a pleasant experience for both the soup consumer and those seated around .
#Text=Slurping and spilling of soup are not pleasant to hear or see , so do your best to avoid these mistakes and you 'll be practicing great dining etiquette .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Be seated at the table .
#Text=If you are eating soup on the couch or somewhere else , be sure to use a Stable Table™ or a tray , to prevent it from slopping around and making a mess , or from burning you .
#Text=Place your serviette or napkin on your lap in case you spill anything .
#Text=Break up any bread or bread roll on the side plate next to you and eat it intermittently with the soup .
#Text=See " Tips " for what not to do with bread and soup .
#Text=Pull the dish close to you to make sure you do n't spill the soup while eating .
#Text=Have the correct spoon .
#Text=A soup spoon is the best spoon to eat soup .
#Text=Failing that , use a spoon larger than a teaspoon but smaller than a serving dish spoon .
#Text=Fill the spoon about three-quarter the way full .
#Text=Do not overfill a soup spoon or it will spill as you lift it .
#Text=Lift your spoon carefully and slowly from the bowl to your mouth .
#Text=Continue eating soup in this manner , methodically , slowly and with care .
#Text=Always place the entire spoon into your mouth to prevent the need to slurp .
#Text=Be careful not to clank it on your teeth .
#Text=As you near the end of the soup , tilt the bowl away from you and not towards you .
#Text=This is considered the polite way to finish soup as there is much less risk of spilling the soup into your lap .
#Text=Rest the spoon in your bowl at the end and push the bowl away from you gently .
#Text=Tips
#Text=The etiquette applies not to some countries .
#Text=For example , traditional Japanese intend to have soup loudly to show their chef that the soup is delicious .
#Text=Avoid " feeding the ducks " in public .
#Text=This is the habit of breaking up pieces of bread and dispersing this throughout your soup .
#Text=Although tasty and a great way to mop up boiling hot soup , this really should only be a family ritual and should never be a part of dinner party or restaurant table meals .
#Text=Do not slurp soup ; it sounds awful , and it is considered very bad manners .
#Text=It will also make people think that you have n't taken any time to care about how you present yourselves to others at the dinner table .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=If soup is hot , blow a little on it first .
#Text=Do this carefully and discreetly .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Soup
#Text=Soup bowl
#Text=Soup spoon
#Text=Serviette/napkin
